item.title: Contact

item.title: index
item.description: About Me I am a computer scientist with research interest in machine learning, computational linguistics and computational social sciences. I worked on problems including language modeling and understanting, topic modeling and supervised/ unsupervised learning in the public and private sectors. I completed my masters in Information Mangement at University of Maryland, College Park where I worked with Jordan Boyd-Graber. I have a bachelor in engineering in Computer Science from Damascus University.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Publications Jude Khouja. “Stance Prediction and Claim Verification: An Arabic Perspective.” Proceedings of the Third Workshop on Fact Extraction and VERification (FEVER) workshop at ACL 2020, (2020). [Paper, Data] Mohamad Alkhouja. “Social media for political change: the activists, governments, and firms triangle of powers during the Arab movement.” Handbook of Research on Political Activism in the Information Age." In: Solo, A.G.M. (ed.) Handbook of Research on Political Activism in the Information Age.
